issue.title: [Python] Add documentation / example for reading a directory of Parquet files on S3
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-1682](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1682). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Opened based on comment https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/916#issuecomment-337563492

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1682?focusedCommentId=16257184) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Documentation patches would be welcome

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1682?focusedCommentId=17142085) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
We have docs for this using the Datasets API: https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/dataset.html#reading-from-cloud-storage

It might still be good to also add something about this on the Parquet doc page.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1682?focusedCommentId=17145072) by Francois Saint-Jacques (fsaintjacques):*
Issue resolved by pull request 7517
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7517>
